references: A. Murthy, Smarandache Notions Journal, Vol. 11 N. 1-2-3 Spring 2000
formula: a(n)=a(n-1)*10^(floor(1+log10(2^n)))+2^n, with a(0)=1 [From _Paolo P. Lava_, Oct 29 2008]
example: 124 belongs to the sequence because it is the concatenation of 2^0, 2^1 and 2^2.
maple: P:=proc(i) local a,n; a:=1; print(a); for n from 2 by 1 to i do a:=(a*10^trunc(evalf(floor(1+log10(2^n)),100))+2^n); print(a); od; end: P(100); [From _Paolo P. Lava_, Oct 29 2008]
author: _Jeff Burch_
